very fun and addicting game to play with your friends, so long as you can look past a ton of bugs and glitches aswell as mediocre events.

Overall the game isn't that bad if only played for 2 hours every so often. If you want to grind or have a game to play everyday you and are competitive in WANTING TO WIN AS A SURVIVOR this is my experience:

The killers AUTOMATICALLY have an advantage over you. They know where all the generators are, and have ABILITIES that allow them to close the distance between you. Originally when this game came out from what I watched the killers at the time were not that much of a big deal; however, now Killers have Chains, Charges, Poison, AoE abilities that can stun or hurt you, and Teleportation; as well as, having their basic attack and a LUNGE attack to down you. Along with their passive abilities that allow them to track you with 'scratch' marks on the floor if you run, or if they hit you once blood left on the floor for a certain period of time. All of which is obv. in favor of the killers.

As the survivor you have to try and manage all of that. Sure, you have pallets to block the attacker, windows to jump through, and lockers you can hide in. Now with all their SPECIAL ABILITIES that each killer has Pallet and windows can become irrelevant. Hiding behind walls to create space between you and killer can become irrelevant if you are playing against someone with AoE abilities. Lockers no one actually uses these often enough to be considered ways to escape lets be honest. Most of the time you are playing it will feel that you are the only one being targeted. There is no real way for a survivor to help you other than forcing themselves in front of the killer to take the hit for you. Unless they have a FLASHLIGHT which doesn't really help if you play with a good enough killer they will be able to still chase you while avoiding it.

When I played killer it was HARD for me to lose track of people because not only could I follow the scratch marks that were made by the survivors. I was simply faster than the survivor when I hadn't even hurt them yet. They could run, but it didn't matter if they made one mistake on their end they would end up taking damage; meanwhile, I could make as many mistakes as I wanted without getting punished. They have it when you play killer you already won the game because everything is based off a point system, so you would legit have to do nothing to not be rewarded by the game, so if you even didn't kill everyone or anyone at all you could still be considered a ruthless killer with almost max points.

TL;DR

The Killers seem almost too OP to where the survivors end up becoming frustrated and end up removing the fun/adrenaline rush you get from running from the killer. I would only recommend this game if they start REMOVE LUNGE attack on killers that already have Gap closing abilities or NERF killers to have longer delay/exhaustion.

Everytime you start up this game you think: "How much torment am I willing to put up with today?"

Things such as:
* Game breaking bugs
* Bully squads
* Hackers 
* Denial of progress
* Other survivors trying to kill you as well
* Sh*tty behaviour endorsement from the developers
Will occur A LOT.
Oh yeah, and Skill based matchmaking is an atrocity. Nothing matters how you do things ingame, only how long the matches last and if you escape, or kill enough. As in, you can get 3 hooks and "win", or 8 hooks and lose.....

For the good of your health, stay away from this game.

It's a pretty good game, the base gameplay is good and overall is pretty fun, but sadly poor visuals mean that you often don't actually feel frightened, a graphics overhaul would be amazing, honestly. 
As I said the gameplay is good and most killers can successfully get good games and also have fun, but, some killers are more fun than others and some are very challenging.
On the other hand playing as a survivor can vary in how fun it is, if you're playing against a decent killer such as the demogorgon and the killer plays properly and quite casually the game can be very fun for both the killer and the survivor, though I often come across toxic killers that play unfairly by camping hooked survivors or overall just kinda being ass holes, but even though this is often the case, the game is still fun most of the time, it's just said that about half of the games I play aren't fun due to players, but overall, good game, fun gameplay, but please fix camping and please update the graphics.

Good game, go try it.

Worst part of this game is BHVR. 

Fixes take forever, cheats are rampant and you have to record your game and write the experience out and send to BHVR through an external site, and according to the cheat makers themselves, "25% of the playerbase on average has some form of cheat active, most just use subtle speed and cooldown enhancements so you wont ever know" you also can't banned ingame cause the anticheat just checks for specific running programs when the game starts, and BHVR themselves cant even look at anything about a match other than endgame chat. In game reports do nothing. 

For Honor crossover was just a basic helmet charm, while the For Honor got new executions and characters from this game, except the executions are way better than the ones that are actually in the game. 

Glitches are rampant too. Always a new game breaking bug to deal with. Recently an infinite loading screen. 

Don't even get me started on the grind, it takes you 500 hours to get a good assortment of perks on 1 survivor, i just got 3 pages of purple perks on 1 survivor and this is my hours. Oh I also brought a perk that gives +100% bloodpoints and i brought it for 99% of my games. While also skipping on all the rare or higher items, offerings and perks to save on bloodpoints to ease the grind.  Imagine how long it would take if you didn't know what your doing. 

Theres also issue like locker DS that are still abusable. 

Oh and the quality of the animations are sub-par at best.

Dont forget the game has no ping restriction either, connect to your local McDonald's and start seeing instant results to your killer rank!!! Unless you play against a cheater of course. 

Wheres the charm to this game? why isnt there random jump scares when opening chests or cleansing stuff maybe? or missing skillchecks? Warzone was scarier than this game. 

Also no new game modes ever? nothing new to the gameplay loop at all? halloween event was just adding pumpkins and one outfit to the game.

Also gotta love the community feedback, oh wait that doesn't exist. getting help or response from the team is like asking Jeff Bezos if you can have a dollar. 

I just wish this game had any other dev team. I appreciate the effort put into it. but like come on. this game feels like its a port of a roblox game with its stability and animations.

Cant wait for other games to compete with it and force them to actually try.
DBD is super fun solo or with friends. The only thing I dislike is that new updates usually break the game.

1. Boot up game after not playing for 2 months
2. Play survivor 
3. Play against toxic/sweaty/overall not fun killer 
4. Play killer instead
5. Play against toxic/sweaty/overall not fun group of survivors
6. Close game
7. Regret
Rinse and repeat 






so yeah 10/10
